about.description:
The chemicals library features an extensive compilation of pure component chemical data that can serve engineers, scientists, technicians, and anyone working with chemicals. The chemicals library facilitates the retrieval and calculation of:

Chemical constants including formula, molecular weight, normal boiling and melting points, triple point, heat of formation, absolute entropy of formation, heat of fusion, similarity variable, dipole moment, accentric factor, etc.
Assorted information of safety and toxicity of chemicals.
Methods (and their respective coefficients) for the calculation of temperature and pressure dependent chemical properties including vapor pressure, heat capacity, molar volume, thermal conductivity, surface tension, dynamic viscosity, heat of vaporization, relative permitivity, etc.
Methods to solve thermodynamic phase equilibrium, including flash routines, vapor-liquid equilibrium constant correlations, and both numerical and analytical solutions for the Rashford Rice and Li-Johns-Ahmadi equations. Rashford Rice solutions for systems of 3 or more phases are also available.

Data for over 20,000 chemicals are made available as local databanks in this library. All databanks are loaded on-demand, saving loading time and RAM. For example, if only data on the normal boiling point is required, the chemicals library will only load normal boiling point datasets. This on-demand loading feature makes the chemicals library an attractive dependence for software modeling chemical processes. In fact, The Biorefinery Simulation and Techno-Economic Analysis Modules (BioSTEAM) is reliant on the chemicals library for the simulation of unit operations.

The chemicals library also supports integration with Numba, a powerful accelerator that works well with NumPy; Pint Quantity objects to keep track of units of measure; and NumPy vectorized functions.

If you need to know something about a chemical, give chemicals a try.
about.summary: Chemical database of Chemical Engineering Design Library (ChEDL)

files: site-packages/chemicals/Density/CRC Inorganics densties of molten compounds and salts.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Density/VDI PPDS Density of Saturated Liquids.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Electrolytes/CRC Thermodynamic Properties of Aqueous Ions.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Heat Capacity/CRC Standard Thermodynamic Properties of Chemical Substances.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Heat Capacity/TRC Thermodynamics of Organic Compounds in the Gas State.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Phase Change/Alibakhshi one-coefficient enthalpy of vaporization.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Phase Change/CRC Handbook Heat of Fusion.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Phase Change/CRC Handbook Heat of Vaporization.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Phase Change/Table 2-150 Heats of Vaporization of Inorganic and Organic Liquids.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Phase Change/VDI PPDS Enthalpies of vaporization.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Thermal Conductivity/Table 2-314 Vapor Thermal Conductivity of Inorganic and Organic Substances.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Thermal Conductivity/Table 2-315 Thermal Conductivity of Inorganic and Organic Liquids.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Thermal Conductivity/VDI PPDS Thermal conductivity of gases.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Thermal Conductivity/VDI PPDS Thermal conductivity of saturated liquids.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Vapor Pressure/Table 2-8 Vapor Pressure of Inorganic and Organic Liquids.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Vapor Pressure/VDI PPDS Boiling temperatures at different pressures.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Viscosity/Table 2-312 Vapor Viscosity of Inorganic and Organic Substances.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Viscosity/Table 2-313 Viscosity of Inorganic and Organic Liquids.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Viscosity/VDI PPDS Dynamic viscosity of gases polynomials.tsv
site-packages/chemicals/Viscosity/VDI PPDS Dynamic viscosity of saturated liquids polynomials.tsv
name: chemicals
raw_recipe:
{% set name = "chemicals" %}
{% set version = "1.0.17" %}


package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.io/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/chemicals-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 5ca049e432c80ec30835612f4a6cac34bc065f15c1d874945b5bdc2f788f4261

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv

requirements:
  host:
    - pip
    - python >=3.6
  run:
    - fluids >=1.0.3
    - pandas
    - python >=3.6
    - scipy

test:
  imports:
    - chemicals
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip

about:
  home: https://github.com/CalebBell/chemicals
  summary: Chemical database of Chemical Engineering Design Library (ChEDL)
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE.txt
  doc_url: https://chemicals.readthedocs.io/
  dev_url: https://github.com/CalebBell/chemicals
  description: |
    The chemicals library features an extensive compilation of pure component chemical data that can serve engineers, scientists, technicians, and anyone working with chemicals. The chemicals library facilitates the retrieval and calculation of:

    Chemical constants including formula, molecular weight, normal boiling and melting points, triple point, heat of formation, absolute entropy of formation, heat of fusion, similarity variable, dipole moment, accentric factor, etc.
    Assorted information of safety and toxicity of chemicals.
    Methods (and their respective coefficients) for the calculation of temperature and pressure dependent chemical properties including vapor pressure, heat capacity, molar volume, thermal conductivity, surface tension, dynamic viscosity, heat of vaporization, relative permitivity, etc.
    Methods to solve thermodynamic phase equilibrium, including flash routines, vapor-liquid equilibrium constant correlations, and both numerical and analytical solutions for the Rashford Rice and Li-Johns-Ahmadi equations. Rashford Rice solutions for systems of 3 or more phases are also available.

    Data for over 20,000 chemicals are made available as local databanks in this library. All databanks are loaded on-demand, saving loading time and RAM. For example, if only data on the normal boiling point is required, the chemicals library will only load normal boiling point datasets. This on-demand loading feature makes the chemicals library an attractive dependence for software modeling chemical processes. In fact, The Biorefinery Simulation and Techno-Economic Analysis Modules (BioSTEAM) is reliant on the chemicals library for the simulation of unit operations.

    The chemicals library also supports integration with Numba, a powerful accelerator that works well with NumPy; Pint Quantity objects to keep track of units of measure; and NumPy vectorized functions.

    If you need to know something about a chemical, give chemicals a try.


extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - volpatto
    - CalebBell
    - yoelcortes
